paper.title: On the synthesis of strategies in infinite games
paper.venue: Symposium on Theoretical Aspects of Computer Science
paper.abstract: Infinite two-person games are a natural framework for the study of reactive nonterminating programs. The effective construction of winning strategies in such games is an approach to the synthesis of reactive programs. We describe the automata theoretic setting of infinite games (given by “game graphs”), outline a new construction of winning strategies in finite-state games, and formulate some questions which arise for games over effectively presented infinite graphs.
